alert.note: Alert for Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 11:29PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Otero and east central Dona Ana Counties through MIDNIGHT MDT... At 1128 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Chaparral, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Otero and east central Dona Ana Counties. This includes Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 11 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
